title: Keir Starmer's Christmas message in full as he thanks NHS, postal and hospitality workers
description: During the holidays many of you will be serving your community, and our country…On behalf of the Labour Party, I send my heartfelt thanks and gratitude to all of you for what you do.“

title: Boost for Rishi Sunak as 'Santa rally' increases hopes of tax cuts in Spring Budget providing dose of optimism for struggling families
description: Rising share values are a signal of optimism on markets and will bring a dose of Christmas cheer to millions of British savers - including those with pension plans - and business leaders.

title: 'NHS dentistry is rotting and in decay after 13 years of Tory neglect'
description: The Tories may be happy to wave goodbye to the vital public service of NHS dentistry, writes Shadow Healthy Secretary Wes Streeting, but Labour won’t let that happen.

title: James Dyson praises Liz Truss in stinging swipe at Rishi Sunak as UK on brink of recession
description: Recent stats show the UK economy shrank in the last quarter, painting a damning image of Mr Sunak's current economic strategy.

title: Third of patients given lethal drugs under right-to-die laws ‘do not take them’
description: Studies of US states show many prescribed assisted dying pills change their mind and experts say prescription is used as ‘insurance policy’

title: Keir Starmer considers scrapping Labour's £28bn green investment plans
description: KEIR Starmer is reportedly considering scaling back Labour ’s £28 billion green investment plans. The Labour leader has long promised that, if elected prime minister, his party would invest £28 billion in green capital investment every year until 2030.

title: Britain’s money is running out. Keir Starmer will have one year to fix it
description: Assume that the opinion polls are right. Suppose that, at some point in 2024, Sir Keir Starmer wins a three-figure majority. What then?

title: Warnings sounded against assisted suicide amid fresh calls for law change
description: Critics of a change to the law have warned against introducing assisted suicide because of the risk to vulnerable people. They point to countries like Canada, Belgium and the Netherlands where legalisation has been a "slippery slope" towards ever expanding criteria, including assisted suicide for mental health issues and minors.

description: At the same time, relations between the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) and Northern Ireland Secretary Chris Heaton-Harris were left battered and bruised after he apparently blindsided the party at Hillsborough. Christmas can be a testing time for relationships but we didn't expect this.

title: Christmas classics you’ll barely believe
description: FIFTY SHADES OF GREY. Slick and well-groomed leading man Sir Keir Starmer the Charmer goes through various contortions as he adopts multiple positions in this controversy-free movie. Despite the subject matter this was the verdict of the critics: "Uninteresting," "intentionally dull," and "devoid of any excitement whatsoever."

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Christmas getaway hell' and UN backs more Gaza aid
description: The Telegraph leads on an interview with businessman Sir James Dyson, who tells the paper the UK needs to focus on growth rather than cutting inflation. He also praises the policies of Liz Truss and Kwasi Kwarteng, adding that wealth generation and growth had become "dirty words".

title: Bridgwater year in review: The biggest stories of 2023

title: Scottish Parliament has become a job creation scheme for mediocre party activists – Susan Dalgety

title: Live facial-recognition cameras catch 22 criminals in one day

title: Nicola Sturgeon detests the Tories but we should detest these politics
